title: Rustdoc search box does not allow the "s" character as the first character in a search term
body:
Using rust nightly, the rustdoc search box doesn't accept the "s" or "S" character as the first character. If you focus the search box and type "StructOptions", you will end up with "tructOptions" in the search field. I believe this is because rustdoc uses the "s" character to focus the search box, but doesn't register that the search box is already focused. 

It seems to only appear when the search box is first focused. If the search box already contains text, the issue does not appear, as you saw me type "Some" without effort. However with the search term "StructOptions", "star" and "secret-sauce", you can see that the first character gets ignored. 

This doesn't happen on documentation that was using the current stable build of rustc, only the nightly version. In the GIF I built the current webrender library using `cargo doc --open` on rustc nightly. It's simply highly annoying that my "s" key is eemingly broken (:wink:). The rust version that was used to build the documentation in the GIF:

Chromium 64.0.3282.119 / Debian 9.4 64-bit

```
rustc 1.26.0-nightly (a04b88d19 2018-03-19)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: a04b88d1941644df01fa5e31dd43e0f57c13d938
commit-date: 2018-03-19
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.26.0-nightly
LLVM version: 6.0
```
